parameter.name: templatesJSON
parameter.description: Defines the default path for the template configuration file.

parameter.name: phase
parameter.description: Defines the default template phase.

parameter.name: waveformStart
parameter.description: Defines the default template waveform start time in seconds w.r.t. the template pick.

parameter.name: waveformEnd
parameter.description: Defines the default template waveform end time in seconds w.r.t. the template pick.

parameter.name: initTime
parameter.description: The default initTime defines a time span in seconds a detector is blind after initialization. This time is needed to initialize the template processors and depends on it.

parameter.name: gapInterpolation
parameter.description: Defines if by default gaps should be interpolated linearly. This is valid for gaps shorter than *maxGapLength* and larger than *minGapLength*.

parameter.name: minGapLength
parameter.description: The default min gap length in seconds to handle. Gaps smaller than the value specified won't be handled.

parameter.name: maxGapLength
parameter.description: The default maximum gap length in seconds to handle. Gaps larger than the value specified will cause the detector to be reset.

parameter.name: timeCorrection
parameter.description: Default time correction applied for an origin issued.

parameter.name: triggerOn
parameter.description: Default threshold which defines when a detector is triggered.

parameter.name: triggerOff
parameter.description: Default threshold which defines when the detector is enabled in order to produce new origins, again. Note that this threshold overrides the *triggerDuration* configuration parameter i.e. as soon as the *triggerOff* threshold is met a detector result is issued.

parameter.name: triggerDuration
parameter.description: Maximum default duration in seconds after reaching the *triggerOn* threshold to search for the maximum correlation between configured streams.

parameter.name: arrivalOffsetThreshold
parameter.description: Maximum default inter arrival offset threshold to tolerate when associating an arrival to an event. The threshold is only validated in a multi-stream detector setup. Configuring a negative value disables the arrival offset validation.

parameter.name: minimumArrivals
parameter.description: Defines the default minimum number of arrivals which must be part of an event to be declared as a detection. Configuring a negative value disables the validation i.e. arrivals for all streams configured must be available.

parameter.name: mergingStrategy
parameter.description:
Defines the default cross-correlation result merging strategy while linking. Possible values are:
- "greaterEqualTriggerOnThreshold": the cross-correlation coefficient must be greater or equal to the configured "triggerOnThreshold" in order to be taken into account for linking.
- "greaterEqualMergingThreshold": the cross-correlation coefficient must be greater or equal to the configured stream configuration specific `"mergingThreshold"` in order to be taken into account for linking.
- "all": tries to merge all cross-correlation results. Trying to merge all cross-correlation results is computationally quite expensive.
Note that the configured merging strategy may have a significant performance impact in a multi-stream detector setup.

parameter.name: createArrivals
parameter.description: Defines the default value for appending *detected arrivals* to declared origins.

parameter.name: createTemplateArrivals
parameter.description: Defines the default value for appending *theoretical template arrivals* to declared origins.

parameter.name: methodId
parameter.description: Defines the default origin *methodID* label that is added to declared origins.

parameter.name: messagingGroup
parameter.description: Defines the messaging group amplitudes are sent to.

parameter.name: calculateAmplitudes
parameter.description: Defines the default value whether amplitude calculation is enabled or disabled (on detector configuration level granularity). Amplitudes are calculated right after an origin has been declared.

parameter.name: filter
parameter.description: Defines the default filter for amplitude processing if no binding filter configuration has been provided. Filtering may be disabled by means of explicitly defining the empty string i.e. "". By default filtering is disabled.

parameter.name: initTime
parameter.description: Defines the default time span in seconds in order to initialize the amplitude processor's filter.

Defines an end time (YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS formatted) for requesting records from the configured archive recordstream. Implicitly enables reprocessing/playback mode.

Enables/disables the calculation of amplitudes regardless of the configuration provided on detector configuration level granularity.
Path to a template configuration file (JSON formatted).

binding.description: Configures a station for amplitude calculation. A station without a binding assigned will not be used for amplitude calculation.

parameter.name: amplitudeProfiles
parameter.description: Defines a list of amplitude profiles for amplitude calculation.

group.name: amplitudes
group.description: Each amplitude profile is a configuration set used for amplitude calculation and allows configuration on sensor location granularity. An amplitude profile is only taken into consideration if a corresponding stream is part of a detector configuration.

parameter.name: locationCode
parameter.description: Defines profile's location code regarding amplitude calculation.

parameter.name: channelCode
parameter.description: Defines profile's channel code regarding amplitude calculation.

parameter.name: enable
parameter.description: Enables/disables amplitude calculation for this profile.

parameter.name: filter
parameter.description: Defines the profile's filter to be used for amplitude calculation. Filtering may be disabled by means of explicitly defining the empty string i.e. "". If no filter has been specified the module default is taken as a fallback.

parameter.name: initTime
parameter.description: Defines the profile's time span in seconds in order to initialize the amplitude processor's filter. The initialization time is configured only in case filtering is enabled.
